title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Datenauswertung
text:
For this analysis we use the dataset from Wiegand (2019a) out of the zip archive Wiegand (2019b). The data are licensed according to Attribution 4.0 International (CC-BY-4.0).
The used wordembeddings are from Grave et al. (2018). The data are licensed according to Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported (CC-BY-SA 3.0).
The picture, that is used is from Altmann (n.d.).

title: Datenauswertung
text:
Trainingsdatensatz

d_train <- read_tsv("C:/Users/sapi-/OneDrive/Studium/5. Semester/Data Science II/Data_Science_Blog/daten/germeval2018.training.txt", col_names = FALSE)

Rows: 5009 Columns: 3
-- Column specification --------------------------------------------------------
Delimiter: "\t"
chr (3): X1, X2, X3

i Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
i Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.



Spalten umbenennen

names(d_train) <- c("text", "c1", "c2")



ID-Spalte einfügen

d_train <- d_train %>% 
  mutate(id = row_number()) %>% 
  select(id, everything())

title: Datenauswertung
text:
Train dataset

d_train <- read_tsv("C:/Users/sapi-/OneDrive/Studium/5. Semester/Data Science II/Data_Science_Blog/daten/germeval2018.training.txt", col_names = FALSE)


Rename columns

names(d_train) <- c("text", "c1", "c2")



Add ID column

d_train <- d_train %>% 
  mutate(id = row_number()) %>% 
  select(id, everything())

title: Datenauswertung
text:
Test dataset

d_test <- read_tsv("C:/Users/sapi-/OneDrive/Studium/5. Semester/Data Science II/Data_Science_Blog/daten/germeval2018.test.txt", col_names = FALSE)


Rename columns

names(d_test) <- c("text", "c1", "c2")



Add ID column

d_test <- d_test %>% 
  mutate(id = row_number()) %>% 
  select(id, everything())

title: Datenauswertung
text:
Insert stopwords_de

data(stopwords_de, package = "lsa")
stopwords_de <- tibble(word = stopwords_de)
stopwords_de <- stopwords_de %>% 
  rename(token = word)


After that we use the stopwords_de to anti_join this with train_toc.


train_toc2 <- train_toc %>% 
  anti_join(stopwords_de)

Joining, by = "token"

title: Datenauswertung
text:
Show the important words

train_toc2 <- train_toc2 %>% 
  count(token, sort = TRUE) 


Plot

train_toc2 %>% 
  slice_head(n=20) %>%  
  ggplot()+
  aes(y=reorder(factor(token), n), x = n, color = token)+
  geom_col(aes(fill = token, alpha = 2.5)) +
  ggtitle("The most used words") +
  ylab("token")+
  xlab("quantity")+
  theme_minimal()+
  theme(legend.position = "none")
